channel.title: Problem running server on linux
channel.description:
I'm running Ubuntu on a vps server.
When i get to the terminal and type in the command to run my server
"java server"
I get this:
[b]root@70963:~/cbsoucre# java server Your server is now online. npcdrops.cfg: file not found. autospawn.cfg: file not found. item.cfg: file not found. globaldrops.cfg: file not found. doors.cfg: file not found. shops.cfg: file not found.[/b]
Please help!

item.title: Problem running server on linux
item.dc:creator: @rawaxo rawaxo
item.description:
@rawaxo wrote:

that means the files are missing.
the reason i know thta because stupid me. accidently deleted them
so my advice is if you have backup…just copy the same files into the “Config Folder”
hope that helps.

if it says this its missing
npcdrops.cfg: file not found.
autospawn.cfg: file not found.
item.cfg: file not found.
globaldrops.cfg: file not found.
doors.cfg: file not found.
shops.cfg: file not found.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem running server on linux
item.dc:creator: @lordman346 lordman346
item.description:
@lordman346 wrote:

Ok thx i should try that ;)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 16, 2009, 01:32:00 pm[/size][hr]W00T THX IT WORKED!!

item.title: Problem running server on linux
item.dc:creator: @samuraiblood2 samuraiblood2
item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

You more than likely need to change the directory. For whatever reason most servers use \ for directories which is very platform dependent, if you change that to / it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem running server on linux
item.dc:creator: @lordman346 lordman346
item.description:
@lordman346 wrote:

You mean placing the shell script in the root of my vps?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 16, 2009, 12:32:17 pm[/size][hr]Should i switch to a Windows vps?

I know almost everything about windows but the VPS are mostly expensive, about $30 a month.

Is there any windows vps that have a maximum of $25 a month?

Read full topic

item.description:

I am not entirely sure.
Tbh it is just easier to make a shell script which you place in the main directory of the server.

ps, I am shit with linux,
